name: AURORA II
description: Another variant of aurora experimenting, this time with different hues, which create completely different saturation points, which in turn creates a completely different work. I really enjoy playing with these. It's exciting to see how the color just defines it's own parameters. It's like trying to control the flow of water down a mountain from a bucker. You can release the water, but the water will go where it wants. The only thing we can control is where the water starts. I always imagine this type of artwork like that process. It's a physical and mental exercise in letting go of control to achieve, ironically, a controlled entropy. I definitely will do more of these later on. So many ideas to get out.
